data.title: Homepage
data.text:
Welcome to Arts Council England

Welcome to Arts Council England

We are the national development agency for creativity and culture.

We’re looking for organisations, artists, events and others to apply for our funding and help us achieve our strategy, Let’s Create.

What we do

Let's Create is our strategy for 2020-2030 and an invitation to join us in creating a country transformed by culture

Photo by Artonik Bell Square. Photo © Vipul Sangoi

1

From grants and resources to events and networking, find out how we can support you.

Photo by Elexi Walker in Queen of Chapeltown © Anthony Robling

2

If you're an individual creative or cultural practitioner, find out how we can support you, so that we make sure we safeguard the future of our industry.

Photo by Serious – EFG London Jazz Festival. Photo: Stephen Wright

3

How to apply

How can I apply?

We invest public money from government and the National Lottery to make sure everyone’s creativity is given the chance to flourish and we all have access to a remarkable range of high quality cultural experiences.

Take a look at our open funding streams and find out if you’re eligible to apply.

Photo by The Hatchling - Trigger. Photo (C) Dom Moore.

4

You can apply to us through Grantium. If you’ve never used it before, we have lots of guidance documents and videos to help you navigate it.

Photo by Digging Devices Our Common Tools by Katie Surridge Photo Pete Millson. Photo: © Pete Millson 2021.

5

If you have access needs and require further support to complete your application, there’s a number of ways we can help, like paying for a support worker.

Photo by Rebecca Banatvala as Aramis in The Dukes production of The Three Musketeers. Photo © Claire Griffiths

6

Our latest news & blogs

Checking in with one another: a statement from Arts Council England

Our Chief Executive, Darren Henley, has written to our funded organisations and projects, with a message of solidarity and support in light of the recent riots and violence in our communities.

Chief Executive Darren Henley reflects on the upcoming Spending Review and the sector's performance one month after the General Election.

Chief Executive Darren Henley reflects on the upcoming Spending Review

Photo by First Art © Lamar Francois 2022

7

The Department for Culture, Media and Sport have published the findings from the 2023/24 Participation Survey.

Survey shows increasing proportion of people visiting museums, galleries and libraries in England in 2023/24

The Wiener Holocaust Library's designated status serves to recognise and celebrate not only the collection itself, but also its unique history.

The Wiener Holocaust Library and Designation Status

Photo by © The Wiener Holocaust Library

8

Designation Status aided RAMM to be able to develop its collection, public gallery and digital resources with new content.

The Royal Albert Memorial Museum & Art Gallery and Designation Status

Photo by © Simon Tutty

9
